org.objectstyle.cayenne.access
Interface QueryEngine

All Known Implementing Classes:
DataContext, DataDomain, DataNode
public interface QueryEngine

Defines methods used to run Cayenne queries.

For more information see Cayenne User Guide.

Author:
Andrei Adamchik

Method Summary
 DataNode dataNodeForObjEntity(ObjEntity objEntity)
          Deprecated. Since 1.1 use lookupDataNode(DataMap) since queries are not necessarily based on an ObjEntity. Use Entity.getDataMap() to obtain DataMap from ObjEntity.
 java.util.Collection getDataMaps()
          Returns a collection of DataMaps associated with this QueryEngine.
 EntityResolver getEntityResolver()
          Returns a resolver for this query engine that is capable of resolving between classes, entity names, and obj/db entities
 DataNode lookupDataNode(DataMap dataMap)
          Returns a DataNode that should handle queries for all DataMap components.
 void performQueries(java.util.Collection queries, OperationObserver resultConsumer)
          Executes a list of queries wrapping them in its own transaction.
 void performQueries(java.util.Collection queries, OperationObserver resultConsumer, Transaction transaction)
          Executes queries in the transactional context provided by the caller.
 void performQuery(Query query, OperationObserver resultConsumer)
          Deprecated. Since 1.1 use performQueries(java.util.Collection,OperationObserver,Transaction)
 

Method Detail

performQueries

public void performQueries(java.util.Collection queries,
                           OperationObserver resultConsumer,
                           Transaction transaction)
Executes queries in the transactional context provided by the caller. It is caller's responsibility to commit or rollback the Transaction and close any connections that were added to it.

Since:
1.1
See Also:
OperationObserver, Transaction

performQueries

public void performQueries(java.util.Collection queries,
                           OperationObserver resultConsumer)
Executes a list of queries wrapping them in its own transaction. Results of execution are passed to OperationObserver object via its callback methods.

Since:
1.1 The signiture has changed from List to Collection.

performQuery

public void performQuery(Query query,
                         OperationObserver resultConsumer)
Deprecated. Since 1.1 use performQueries(java.util.Collection,OperationObserver,Transaction)

Executes a single query. Will notify resultConsumer about query progress and results.

dataNodeForObjEntity

public DataNode dataNodeForObjEntity(ObjEntity objEntity)
Deprecated. Since 1.1 use lookupDataNode(DataMap) since queries are not necessarily based on an ObjEntity. Use Entity.getDataMap() to obtain DataMap from ObjEntity.

Returns a DataNode that handles database operations for a specified ObjEntity.

lookupDataNode

public DataNode lookupDataNode(DataMap dataMap)
Returns a DataNode that should handle queries for all DataMap components.

Since:
1.1

getEntityResolver

public EntityResolver getEntityResolver()
Returns a resolver for this query engine that is capable of resolving between classes, entity names, and obj/db entities

getDataMaps

public java.util.Collection getDataMaps()
Returns a collection of DataMaps associated with this QueryEngine.
